trans-unit.source: Searches a directory for a file or subdirectory with a name that matches a specific name

seg-source.mrk: Searches a directory for a file or subdirectory with a name that matches a specific name

target.mrk: Searches a directory for a file or subdirectory with a name that matches a specific name

trans-unit.source: The directory or path, and the file name, which can include wildcard characters, for example, an asterisk "*" or a question mark "?".

seg-source.mrk: The directory or path, and the file name, which can include wildcard characters, for example, an asterisk "*" or a question mark "?".

target.mrk: The directory or path, and the file name, which can include wildcard characters, for example, an asterisk "*" or a question mark "?".

trans-unit.source: If the string ends with a wildcard, period ".", or directory name, the user must have access permissions to the root and all subdirectories on the path.

seg-source.mrk: If the string ends with a wildcard, period ".", or directory name, the user must have access permissions to the root and all subdirectories on the path.

target.mrk: If the string ends with a wildcard, period ".", or directory name, the user must have access permissions to the root and all subdirectories on the path.

trans-unit.source: A $tagWIN32_FIND_DATA structure or a pointer to it that receives information about a found file or directory.

seg-source.mrk: A $tagWIN32_FIND_DATA structure or a pointer to it that receives information about a found file or directory.

target.mrk: A $tagWIN32_FIND_DATA structure or a pointer to it that receives information about a found file or directory.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

trans-unit.source: This function opens a search handle and returns information about the first file that the file system finds with a name that matches the specified pattern.

seg-source.mrk: This function opens a search handle and returns information about the first file that the file system finds with a name that matches the specified pattern.

target.mrk: This function opens a search handle and returns information about the first file that the file system finds with a name that matches the specified pattern.

trans-unit.source: This may or may not be the first file or directory that appears in a directory-listing application when given the same file name string pattern.

seg-source.mrk: This may or may not be the first file or directory that appears in a directory-listing application when given the same file name string pattern.

target.mrk: This may or may not be the first file or directory that appears in a directory-listing application when given the same file name string pattern.

trans-unit.source: After the search handle is established, you can use it to search for other files that match the same pattern by using the _WinAPI_FindNextFile() function.

seg-source.mrk: After the search handle is established, you can use it to search for other files that match the same pattern by using the _WinAPI_FindNextFile() function.

target.mrk: After the search handle is established, you can use it to search for other files that match the same pattern by using the _WinAPI_FindNextFile() function.

trans-unit.source: If the function fails because no matching files can be found, the @extended flag will contain ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND (2) system error code.

seg-source.mrk: If the function fails because no matching files can be found, the @extended flag will contain ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND (2) system error code.

target.mrk: If the function fails because no matching files can be found, the @extended flag will contain ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND (2) system error code.

trans-unit.source: When the search handle is no longer needed, close it by using the _WinAPI_FindClose() function.

seg-source.mrk: When the search handle is no longer needed, close it by using the _WinAPI_FindClose() function.

target.mrk: When the search handle is no longer needed, close it by using the _WinAPI_FindClose() function.
